event.name: ETAPS 2026
event.description: The ETAPS International Joint Conferences on Theory and Practice of Software is the primary forum for academic and industrial researchers working on topics relating to Software Science. It has been an annual event held each spring since 1998. Its 29th edition, ETAPS 2026, will be held on April 11â€“16, 2026, in Torino, Italy.
main_conferences: FASE: Fundamental Approaches to Software Engineering
FoSSaCS: Foundations of Software Science and Computation Structures
TACAS: Tools and Algorithms for the Construction and Analysis of Systems

call_for_satellite_events.description: The ETAPS 2026 organizing committee invites proposals for satellite events (e.g., workshops) to complement the main conferences.
call_for_satellite_events.scope: Satellite events should fall within the scope of ETAPS.
call_for_satellite_events.opportunity: Satellite events provide an opportunity to discuss and report on emerging research approaches and practical experiences relevant to the theory and practice of software.

organizers_expectations: create and maintain a website for the event
form a PC and produce a call for papers for the event (if appropriate)
advertise the event through mailing lists etc. to complement the publicity of ETAPS
review submissions and make acceptance decisions
prepare informal (pre-)proceedings for the event, if appropriate
prepare the event's program according to the overall schedule of ETAPS 2026
prepare and organize the publication of formal (post-)proceedings, if desired
committee_expectations: promote the event on the website and in the publicity material of ETAPS 2026
arrange registration for the event as a component of registration for ETAPS
collect a participation fee from the registrants
provide a meeting room of appropriate size, A/V equipment, coffee breaks, and possibly lunch(es)
arrangements.note: As a rule, ETAPS will not contribute toward the travel or accommodation costs of invited speakers or organizers of satellite events.

requested_information: name and acronym of the satellite event
names and contact information of the organizers
duration of the event (one or two days) and the preferred period
brief description (120 words approximately) of the event topic for ETAPS 2026 publicity
brief explanation of the event topic and its relevance to ETAPS
description of organizer's background, including relevant experience and contact information
publicity strategy and selection procedure of contributions; PC chair and members, if known; information about past editions
any other relevant information such as special format, invited speakers, demo sessions, special requirements
tentative schedule for paper submission, notification of acceptance, and final versions for (informal pre-)proceedings
plans for formal publication (no publication, formal proceedings ready by the event, post-proceedings, publication venue)
submission_guidelines.evaluation: Proposals will be evaluated by the ETAPS 2026 organizing committee based on their assessed benefit for prospective participants.
